concept.title: Types of Margins on a Typewriter
concept.shortdesc: A typewriter uses two types of margins, visible and non-visivle or magic margins

section.title: Visible Margins
section.p: Visible margins use physical margin stops that restrict carriage movement. They appear on older machines and provide a clear, manual way to define left and right boundaries.

section.title: Nonvisible Margins
section.p: Nonvisible margins, or “Magic Margins,” use internal mechanisms activated by buttons. They store margin positions automatically and remove the need for visible stops.
